title: Datalad save to annex files that were already in git

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: Issue is unlikely to be addressed

body:
#### What is the problem?

Whenever a file (which was under git) gets modified in a subdataset, and gets added to the parent dataset with `datalad add -d . subdataset`, the file gets committed to annex instead of git.

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

```terminal
contematto@talete /tmp $ datalad create test_dataset
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/test_dataset
create(ok): /tmp/test_dataset (dataset)

contematto@talete /tmp $ cd test_dataset

contematto@talete /tmp/test_dataset (master) $ datalad create subdataset
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/test_dataset/subdataset
create(ok): /tmp/test_dataset/subdataset (dataset)

contematto@talete /tmp/test_dataset (master*) $ datalad add -d . subdataset
add(ok): subdataset (dataset) [added new subdataset]
add(notneeded): subdataset (dataset) [nothing to add from /tmp/test_dataset/subdataset]
add(notneeded): .gitmodules (file) [already included in the dataset]
save(ok): /tmp/test_dataset (dataset)
action summary:
  add (notneeded: 2, ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)

contematto@talete /tmp/test_dataset (master) $ cd subdataset

contematto@talete /tmp/test_dataset/subdataset (master) $ touch myfileingit.txt

contematto@talete /tmp/test_dataset/subdataset (master*) $ git add myfileingit.txt

contematto@talete /tmp/test_dataset/subdataset (master*) $ git commit -m "Added file"
[master 1c48f6d] Added file
 1 file changed, 0 insertions(+), 0 deletions(-)
 create mode 100644 myfileingit.txt

contematto@talete /tmp/test_dataset/subdataset (master) $ ls
myfileingit.txt

contematto@talete /tmp/test_dataset/subdataset (master) $ cd ..

contematto@talete /tmp/test_dataset (master*) $ ls
subdataset

contematto@talete /tmp/test_dataset (master*) $ datalad add -d . subdataset
add(notneeded): subdataset/myfileingit.txt (file) [already included in the dataset]
add(notneeded): subdataset (dataset) [already known subdataset]
save(notneeded): /tmp/test_dataset/subdataset (dataset)
save(ok): /tmp/test_dataset (dataset)
action summary:
  add (notneeded: 2)
  save (notneeded: 1, ok: 1)

contematto@talete /tmp/test_dataset (master) $ ls -l subdataset/myfileingit.txt
-rw-r--r--  1 contematto  wheel  0 Nov 20 12:42 subdataset/myfileingit.txt

contematto@talete /tmp/test_dataset (master) $ echo "adding stuff" >> subdataset/myfileingit.txt

contematto@talete /tmp/test_dataset (master) $ datalad add -d . subdataset
add(ok): subdataset/myfileingit.txt (file)
add(notneeded): subdataset (dataset) [already known subdataset]
save(ok): /tmp/test_dataset/subdataset (dataset)
save(ok): /tmp/test_dataset (dataset)
action summary:
  add (notneeded: 1, ok: 1)
  save (ok: 2)

contematto@talete /tmp/test_dataset (master) $ ls -l subdataset
total 8
lrwxr-xr-x  1 contematto  wheel  118 Nov 20 12:43 myfileingit.txt -> .git/annex/objects/x4/xK/MD5E-s13--ef8174b2381e2ac9c2b0f2a8a39e5031.txt/MD5E-s13--ef8174b2381e2ac9c2b0f2a8a39e5031.txt
```

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad plugin wtf`)?

datalad 0.9.1

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (Sometimes we get tired of reading bug reports all day and a lil' positive end note does wonders)

I love datalad <3
